definition: to hand in/to hand over/to seize
to receive/to accept/to enjoy/to bring into/to pay (tax etc)/nano- (one billionth)/to reinforce sole of shoes or stockings by close sewing

sentences.english: The inspectors soon saw through his scheme to avoid paying income tax.
sentences.chinese: 稽查員一眼就看穿了他企圖逃避繳納所得的詭計。

sentences.english: Certain other expenses also may be deducted from taxable income, or one may elect to use the "standard deduction.
sentences.chinese: 某些其他支出也可從應繳納的個人收入稅中扣除。

sentences.english: The State encourages paying the central tax on time.
sentences.chinese: 國家提倡按時繳納中央稅。

sentences.english: In addition, the transfer of housing but also for value-added part of the paid income tax.
sentences.chinese: 此外，房屋轉讓時還要爲增值部分繳納個人所得稅。

sentences.english: Article 9 The motor vehicle and vessel tax shall be paid annually.
sentences.chinese: 第九條車船稅按年申報繳納。

sentences.english: Services are usually made available through a flat-rate subscription fee or on a pay-per-use basis.
sentences.chinese: 服務通常需要繳納固定的訂閱費用或者按用戶收費。

sentences.english: Students wil be charged 35% of the Course fees for the exempted course.
sentences.chinese: 免修需按該門課學費總額的35%向學院繳納免修費。

sentences.english: Even the taxes they impose in certain areas are lesser.
sentences.chinese: 甚至他們在特殊領域繳納的稅也比較輕。

sentences.english: Car-owners, for example, pay no car or road tax.
sentences.chinese: 舉例來說，當前車主不需要繳納車稅或路稅。

sentences.english: But the social charges which employers and employees have to pay the government are very high.
sentences.chinese: 但是僱主和僱員須向政府繳納的社會保險是非常高的。

sentences.english: The duty sign that should notice a bank you grows with avoiding pay usury duty.
sentences.chinese: 要通知銀行你的稅號以避免繳納高利息稅。

sentences.english: The Embassy shall pay for the city infrastructure fee.
sentences.chinese: 使館繳納城市基礎設施建設費。

sentences.english: Does not commute a punishment the short-term set term of imprisonment to the malicious payment, replaces the fine the payment.
sentences.chinese: 對惡意不繳納者易科短期有期徒刑，代替罰金的繳納。

sentences.english: Does not commute a punishment the short-term set term of imprisonment to the malicious payment, replaces the fine the payment.
sentences.chinese: 對惡意不繳納者易科短期有期徒刑，代替罰金的繳納。

sentences.english: There will be NO refund of the registration fee if the registered participants do not attend the forum.
sentences.chinese: 繳納註冊費後，若因故不能出席論壇將不獲退款。

sentences.english: Bonded warehouse operators must show that they have the ability to meet the Customs duties and obligations.
sentences.chinese: 保稅倉庫的經理人應具備向海關繳納稅款的能力。

definition: to hand in/to hand over/to seize
to pay/to hand over (tax payment etc)
a loan/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/to provide a loan (e.g. bank)/to raise a loan (from e.g. a bank)
to return (sth borrowed etc)/to send back/to refund/to rebate
to report (to the authorities)/to declare (to customs)
provision/to fix/to set/to formulate/to stipulate/to provide/regulation/rule/CL:個|个[ge4]
